alert.note: Alert for Northumberland; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 3:05PM EDT until July 07 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Northumberland and Union. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milton, Lewisburg, Watsontown, Linntown, New Columbia, Montandon, Spruce Run Reservoir, West Milton and McEwensville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
